linefit

Interface HasOptionsToDisplay

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ExportIO

    public interface HasOptionsToDisplay
    This interface should be used for classes and objects that have options that should be displayed in the GUI so that the user can change them. It provides a set of standardized functions to create, position, display, apply changes, etc.
    Since:
    0.99.0
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Keith Rice

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addOptionsGuiElementsToTabs(TabsFocusTraversalPolicy policy)
      Adds the GUI options to the traversal policy for tabs for the Container
      void applyValuesInOptionsGuiElements()
      Applies the current values in the GUI options
      void createOptionsGuiElements(java.awt.Container contentPane)
      Creates the GUI elements associated with the options of this class to the default values
      void positionOptionsGuiElements(java.awt.Insets insets, int xOffset, int yOffset)
      Positions the GUI elements appropriately using the passed offsets to position it so it fits well with any other classes that are displaying GUI elements
      void resetOptionsGuiElementsToDefaultValues()
      Resets the GUI elements associated with the options of this class to the default values

    • Method Detail

      • createOptionsGuiElements

        void createOptionsGuiElements(java.awt.Container contentPane)
        Creates the GUI elements associated with the options of this class to the default values
        Parameters:
        contentPane - The Container to add the elements to

      • positionOptionsGuiElements

        void positionOptionsGuiElements(java.awt.Insets insets,
                                int xOffset,
                                int yOffset)
        Positions the GUI elements appropriately using the passed offsets to position it so it fits well with any other classes that are displaying GUI elements
        Parameters:
        insets - The Insets of the Container the GUI elements reside in
        xOffset - The x offset to apply to the GUI elements so that they fit with any other GUI elements being displayed by other classes
        yOffset - The y offset to apply to the GUI elements so that they fit with any other GUI elements being displayed by other classes

      • resetOptionsGuiElementsToDefaultValues

        void resetOptionsGuiElementsToDefaultValues()
        Resets the GUI elements associated with the options of this class to the default values

      • applyValuesInOptionsGuiElements

        void applyValuesInOptionsGuiElements()
        Applies the current values in the GUI options

      • addOptionsGuiElementsToTabs

        void addOptionsGuiElementsToTabs(TabsFocusTraversalPolicy policy)
        Adds the GUI options to the traversal policy for tabs for the Container
        Parameters:
        policy - The tab policy to add the GUI options to
